title: Understanding Spontaneity in Reactions
text: A spontaneous reaction is one that occurs naturally under certain conditions and results in the release of free energy.

title: Relation between Gibbs Free Energy and Reaction Spontaneity
text: Recall the equation for the change in Gibbs free energy: $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S$$. A reaction is spontaneous when $$\Delta G<0$$.

title: Consider Entropy and Enthalpy Contribution
text: For a spontaneous process at constant temperature and pressure, $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S<0$$. If ΔS is negative, ΔH must be negative and larger in magnitude than $$T \Delta S$$ for ΔG to be negative.

title: Evaluate ΔH against TΔS
text: Given that ΔS is negative, if ΔH is also negative, how does ΔH compare to the product of T and ΔS?
choices: ΔH and TΔS are both negative
